relatedBlades.title: Compliance is evolving — is your resilience ready?
relatedBlades.copy: NIS2 and DORA reflect a key shift in the regulatory landscape — privacy officers must broaden their role beyond keeping sensitive data private, and help defend against threats and maintain availability of services.

features.title: Can AI find vulnerabilities?
features.description: Why AI is a double-edged sword when it comes to security and how to future-proof against vulnerability exploits

features.title: Ensure security and governance for AI agents
features.description: 96% of IT leaders plan to expand their use of AI agents in the next 12 months — CSO, Grant Bourzikas shares how to implement a three step plan to establish security and governance before wide-scale agent deployment

features.description: AI shows potential to address complex societal challenges, but agencies must balance innovation with safeguarding citizens' interests

features.title: Modernization is a CxO team sport
features.description: Too many modernization projects fail before they start. Misaligned CxO priorities lead to delays, higher security costs, and lost customers. Here's what successful organizations do differently

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - Future Internet - Modernization is a CxO team sport - Image

features.title: Transforming digital services for government
features.description: To meet new efficiency mandates, government agencies must increase citizen adoption of digital services by improving the user experience

features.description: Attackers are poised to use quantum computers to break cryptographic systems — organizations must prepare and build a security strategy for the post-quantum era

features.description: Securing a remote workforce requires a holistic security strategy that eliminates complexity and security gaps

features.title: Secure AI for state and local government

features.title: AI is disrupting software purchases
features.description: AI capabilities are being added to existing vendor contracts under the radar — before buying or renewing software, organizations must be sure they understand how new AI features affect security and data privacy

features.title: Why web applications are a C-suite priority
features.description: Application failures can cost companies millions — like the 6 hour outage of Meta apps leading to $60 million in losses. Here's how technology leaders can rethink combating this threat to the bottom line

imageAssetFile.title: Why web applications are a C-suite priority

features.title: Using AI to tell a story with data
features.description: CEO of Sushidata shares how applying AI to unstructured customer data can help organizations deepen customer insights and improve experiences — enhancing satisfaction and minimize defections

features.title: Tech sprawl emulates the snake game
features.description: Enterprises have added more and more point solutions as they have grown, much like the snake adding segments in the old 1980s cell phone game. Complex enterprise security stacks are causing friction and slowing business down

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - Mike Hamilton - image

features.title: Modern security innovations and trends: From AI to quantum
features.description: Generative AI and quantum computing promise to revolutionize cyber security by enhancing the efficiency of security operations and sparking new threats

features.title: AI governance starts with data governance
features.description: Governing the use of AI in the enterprise is essential for reducing risks. Because AI depends on data, AI governance must start with data governance

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - CxO Digital Magazine - Future Internet - Overcoming the challenges of data sovereignty - Image

features.title: Balancing data sovereignty and AI
features.description: Organizations need ways to leverage AI without letting data cross geographical borders. Unless they can control where models run and how models are updated, they risk costly regulatory violations

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - CxO Digital Magazine - Future Internet - Balancing data sovereignty and AI - Image

features.title: Preparing for the future of AI in cyber security
features.description: In 20 years, AI will reshape our world considerably. But too many organizations are focused exclusively on what AI can do today —  to make the most of AI in the future, organizations need to build a long-term strategy and start modernizing security now

features.title: CTOs guide on AI-assisted development
features.description: Technology leaders are eager to explore AI-assisted development to enhance efficiency and accelerate results — 8 best practices for managing the risks of AI integration

features.title: The state of cloud security
features.description: Developing resilient, forward-looking security strategies will become more important to explore the complex world of cloud security and realize its full potential while minimizing risks to businesses

features.title: AI's role in reinventing the customer experience
features.description: Nan Guo, SVP of Engineering at Zendesk shares how she utilizes AI to personalize the consumer and employee experience — while adhering to the principle of security-by-design

features.title: Enhance cyber security and build resilience
features.description: Incidents like last year's record-breaking DDoS attacks and recent high-profile breaches underscore the need for organizations to be fully engaged in their current cyber security efforts — 4 key initiatives to help balance today's threats with the evolving landscape

features.description: Digital natives are taking advantage of Zero Trust and leading a change in cyber security — here are the top 5 benefits they are experiencing.

features.title: Overcoming the challenges of data sovereignty
features.description: More than 100 countries have enacted laws aimed at protecting the privacy of their citizen's personal information—and that's a good thing. However, complying with these laws can pose serious challenges to global businesses
